member.name: API_CC_CW_ACCEPT_REL_ACTIVE
member.description: Accept waiting call and release active call

typedef.name: ApiCcConEiType
typedef.description: This type is used to hold the Connection Instance, identifying the endpoint in the switch control.

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to initiate a call / connection. The call can be: external outgoing call intercom to another PP service connection

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The connection instance for the connection. The ConEi is supplied by the MMI. A utility function (TBD) is available for the MMI to request an individual ConEi for this call.

parameter.name: BasicService
parameter.description: Narrow/wide band speech encoding

parameter.name: CallClass
parameter.description: DECT defined call classes.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task searches through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Info elements: [API_IE_MULTIKEYPAD] [API_IE_CALLING_NUMBER] [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY] [API_IE_LINE_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used to indicate that the base needs dial info to proceed with the call

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by the setup_req. For this call/connection the selected connection instance should be used for following call handling mails

parameter.name: ProgressInd
parameter.description: Inband information

parameter.name: Signal
parameter.description: Alert signal. This is used to request the MMI to start a certain local tone.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY]

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI of the call progress. No more dialed digits will be accepted.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: ProgressInd
parameter.description: Inband information

parameter.name: Signal
parameter.description: Alert signal. Can be used to control which ringer melody to be used.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST]

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI when the called party has started alerting / ringing. No more dialed digits will be accepted.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: ProgressInd
parameter.description: Inband information

parameter.name: Signal
parameter.description: Alert signal. Can be used to control which ringer melody to be used.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST]

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI when the called party has answered the call. The audio shall be unmuted if not already done.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST]

mail.description: This mail informs the FP that the audio is connected. In many implementations it is not used, and the FP just connects the audio a short time after the connect_ind is sent.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST]

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI of an incoming air link from the protocol. E.g. incoming call from the PSTN, intercom calls, service connections, etc...

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: BasicService
parameter.description: Narrow/wide band speech encoding

parameter.name: CallClass
parameter.description: DECT defined call classes.

parameter.name: Signal
parameter.description: Alert signal. Can be used to control which ringer melody is used at Called endpoint.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Info elements: [API_IE_CALLING_PARTY_NUMBER] [API_IE_CALLING_PARTY_NAME] [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY] [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to inform the protocol that a SetupInd has been received and that MMI has indicated the alert to the user.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The handset id and connection instance.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to request the protocol to answer the call.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The handset id and connection instance.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST]

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to inform the MMI that the connection is established. The audio path to the handset is established and shall now be unmuted, if not already done.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The handset id and connection instance.

mail.description: This mail is used to send various information from FP to PP.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by the setup_req. For this call/connection the selected connection instance should be used for following call handling mails

parameter.name: ProgressInd
parameter.description: Inband information

parameter.name: Signal
parameter.description: Alert signal. This is used to request the MMI to start a certain local tone.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CALLING_PARTY_NUMBER] [API_IE_CALLING_PARTY_NAME] [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY] [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID] [API_IE_CALL_STATUS] [API_IE_MULTI_DISPLAY]

mail.description: This mail is used to send various information from PP to FP

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by the setup_req. For this call/connection the selected connection instance should be used for following call handling mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MULTIKEYPAD] [API_IE_CALLED_NUMBER] [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY] [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to terminate a call.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.description: DECT reason code

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_RELEASE_EXT_REASON] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY]

mail.description: This mail is used indicate to the MMI a confirmation of the API_FP_RELEASE_REQ command.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_PROPRIETARY]

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI when the connected party has terminated the ongoing call or reject an incoming call.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.description: DECT reason code

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_RELEASE_EXT_REASON] [API_IE_PROPRIETARY]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to inform the handset when the call is released, ie. the MMI has muted the audio.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_PROPRIETARY]

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI when e.g. a connection setup has been rejected

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.description: DECT reason code

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_RELEASE_EXT_REASON]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to reject a call.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.description: DECT reason code

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [IE_RELEASE_EXT_REASON]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to receive IWU Info messages during a call. Typically used to receive messages using LRMS.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MMS_GEN_HEADER] [API_IE_MMS_OBJ_HEADER] [API_IE_MMS_EXT_HEADER] [API_IE_TIME_DATE] [API_IE_SEGMENT_INFO] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU]
NOTE: Some of the Infoelements are only available if SMS support is enabled

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to send IWU Info messages during a call. Typically used to send messages using LRMS.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MMS_GEN_HEADER] [API_IE_MMS_OBJ_HEADER] [API_IE_MMS_EXT_HEADER] [API_IE_TIME_DATE] [API_IE_SEGMENT_INFO] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU]
NOTE: Some of the Infoelements are only available if SMS support is enabled

mail.description: This command is used to request a connection EI for a new connection.
This command is used to confirm the API_CC_GET_CONEI_REQ command.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: Connection endpoint identifier

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI when the switch control have changed the ConEI of the ongoing call. When the MMI receives this mail, the NewConEi should be used in stead of the original ConeEi as connection reference for the call.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control.

parameter.name: NewConEi
parameter.description: The New Instance of the connection re-assigned by switch control. For further signaling the handling of the call/connection the received NewConEi should be used.

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to request a CODEC change for a connection.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Required Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] The Codec list shall contain one and only one codec.

mail.description: Used by the MMI to confirm the API_CC_MODIFY_CODEC_REQ. If the change is accepted then the audio must be muted.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates whether the command succeeded or not.

mail.description: This mail is used to inform the MMI when a handset has requested a CODEC change for a connection.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] The Codec list shall contain one and only one codec.

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to accept or reject a code change requested by a handset. If the change is accepted, then the audio must be muted.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates whether the command succeeded or not.

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to inform the MMI when the CODEC has been changed for a connection and the audio shall be unmuted.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_CODEC_LIST] The Codec list shall contain one and only one codec.

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to either accept or reject the call waiting. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x35} to the switch control if Accept is TRUE otherwise {0x1c, 0x36}.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: Accept
parameter.description: Accept = 1 if the Call Waiting is accepted.

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the format:
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description:
This mail is sent from MMI to request a second intercom call. (putting the other call party on hold call the selected second party) When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x17, keypad} to the switch control.
If the multikeypad is a ?*? then it will be interpreted as a call to all handsets. In case there is no ambiguity (i.e. when there are only two registered PPs switched on), the MultikeypadLength can be 0.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MULTIKEYPAD]

mail.description: This mail is sent from MMI to request a second external call. (putting the other call party on hold, then call the selected second party) When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x15, keypad} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MULTIKEYPAD] [API_IE_LINE_ID]

mail.description: This mail is sent from MMI to request a multiparty call. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x32} to the switch control. The current call and a held call will be joined.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is sent from MMI to transfer a call to another party. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x34} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is sent from MMI to toggle between two call parties. (e.g. the PSTN line and a handset) When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x31} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to put the active call on hold. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x41} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to retrieve a held call. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x42} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to end the call that is indicated by the SystemCallId. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x33} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_LINE_ID] [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to request redirection of an incoming call to an external party. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x39, 0x15} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MULTIKEYPAD]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to request redirection of an incoming call to an internal party. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x39, 0x17} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_MULTIKEYPAD]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to accept a call screening setup req. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x48} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the MMI to connect to a screened call and stop the TAM. When received by the API it will then send a Multi-Keypad info element with {0x1c, 0x49} to the switch control.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_SYSTEM_CALL_ID]

mail.description: This mail is used by the API to send incoming CLMS data with infoelements to the MMI.

parameter.name: ConEi
parameter.description: The Instance of the connection defined by switch control. For this call/connection the received ConnectionEi should be used for responding mails

parameter.name: InfoElement
parameter.description:
The InfoElementList can hold a number Info Elements placed in the in the format
{ Ie, IeLength, IeData[], Ie, IeLength, IeData[], ...}
Each element is packed following the ApiInfoElementType.
At reception the receiving task should search through the info data package to search for the requested elements and pick out the info data.
Possible Infoelements: [API_IE_PORTABLE_IDENTITY] [API_IE_MMS_GEN_HEADER] [API_IE_MMS_OBJ_HEADER] [API_IE_MMS_EXT_HEADER] [API_IE_TIME_DATE] [API_IE_SEGMENT_INFO] [API_IE_IWU_TO_IWU]
NOTE: Some of the Infoelements are only available if SMS support is enabled
